pull.title: doc: Remove explicit mention of versions from SECURITY.md
pull.body:
The repo should not contain documentation that is not tied to any release. For example meta information like a list of maintained versions of Bitcoin Core falls into this scope.

Replace the list of versions in `./SECURITY.md` with a link to the website.

events.message: doc: Remove explicit mention of version from SECURITY.md

events.body:
Just to understand the context: what changed since https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16140#issuecomment-498848447? :-)

> I think we should also move the EOL policy from the website into the repo, but that might be also good for a follow up pull request.
With "good for a follow up pull request" I meant that it might be controversial. My primary point was that the policy should only be maintained in one place.
@practicalswift This was discussed on the IRC meeting yesterday.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16213/commits/fa4bc4ebf91e2bf4732063f7a374a98902436a7c

IRC discussion is available [here](http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-06-13.html) (starting line 626).
